investors.name: Peak XV Partners (formerly Sequoia Capital India)
investors.description: A globally renowned VC firm with a strong presence in India. They are known for their multi-stage investments and for backing some of India's biggest tech success stories.

investors.name: Accel
investors.description: Another leading global VC firm with a significant portfolio in India. Accel focuses on partnering with exceptional founding teams from the early stages.

investors.name: Blume Ventures
investors.description: An early-stage venture fund based in Bengaluru. They are known for being the 'first institutional check' for many startups and for providing extensive support and mentorship.

investors.name: Kalaari Capital
investors.description: An early-stage, tech-focused VC firm based in Bengaluru. Kalaari is well-known for its founder-first approach and for supporting founders with a long-term vision.

investors.name: Matrix Partners India
investors.description: Affiliated with the global Matrix Partners, this Indian fund focuses on a diverse range of sectors, often investing in companies that address the needs of the Indian consumer.

investors.name: 3one4 Capital
investors.description: A VC firm that funds early-stage Indian companies driving innovation and disruption. They have a strong focus on data-driven and technology-enabled businesses.

investors.name: Chiratae Ventures
investors.description: Formerly IDG Ventures India, Chiratae is one of the leading venture capital firms in the country. They invest in technology startups from an early stage, providing hands-on support.

investors.name: Stellaris Venture Partners
investors.description: An investment firm founded by former partners of leading VCs. They specialize in early-stage ventures and have a portfolio that focuses on a mix of consumer and B2B startups.

investors.name: India Quotient
investors.description: A VC firm that provides seed funding to startups aimed at the Indian consumer. They are known for their founder-friendly approach and for creating a powerful network.

investors.name: Tiger Global Management
investors.description: An American investment firm that has been one of the most prolific and fast-moving investors in the Indian startup ecosystem, often leading large, late-stage rounds. They do not have a public-facing application portal for new pitches.

investors.name: Indian Angel Network (IAN)
investors.description: One of the largest and oldest angel investor networks in India. IAN brings together successful entrepreneurs and business leaders to invest in and mentor early-stage startups.

investors.name: Mumbai Angels Network
investors.description: A prominent angel network that connects early-stage startups with a diverse group of investors. They provide not just capital but also a strong network and strategic guidance.

investors.name: Titan Capital
investors.description: Founded by Snapdeal co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, this is a prominent angel investment firm that has backed a wide range of early-stage startups.

investors.name: Inflection Point Ventures (IPV)
investors.description: An angel investing platform that has quickly grown to become a significant player in the Indian startup ecosystem, providing a platform for investors to co-invest.

investors.name: AngelList India
investors.description: A global platform that has become a crucial part of the Indian startup funding ecosystem, allowing founders to raise capital from a network of angel investors through syndicates and special purpose vehicles (SPVs).

investors.name: Anupam Mittal
investors.description: Founder and CEO of People Group (Shaadi.com). A well-known angel investor with a diverse portfolio and a public profile as a judge on Shark Tank India.
investors.contact: Typically approached via professional networks or platforms like AngelList.

investors.name: Kunal Shah
investors.description: Founder of CRED and Freecharge. A highly respected and active angel investor in the Indian startup ecosystem.
investors.contact: Usually through referrals or professional networks.

investors.name: Gaurav Munjal
investors.description: Co-founder and CEO of Unacademy. He has become an active angel investor, supporting a new generation of founders.

investors.name: Anand Chandrasekaran
investors.description: A product executive and angel investor with a strong background in tech. He has invested in a number of prominent Indian and global startups.
investors.contact: Can be reached through professional platforms like LinkedIn or referrals.

investors.name: T.V. Mohandas Pai
investors.description: A former board member of Infosys and a prolific angel investor and venture capitalist. He is a strong advocate for the Indian startup ecosystem and an active mentor.
investors.contact: Associated with private equity firms and can be found on professional platforms.
